page_analysis.text_content:
Basements & Excavated features

Floor area regulations are intended to address the building mass and the appearance of the streetscape. Therefore, if basement area is below grade and does not contribute to the apparent mass of a building, that area, even if it is habitable, need not be included in the total floor area.

Code sections
Page 40
18.12.090 (a, b, & c)
Page 41
18.12.090 (c)
Page 43
18.12.090 (c) (1)
Page 44
18.12.090 (c) (2)

Basement standards

• May not be located in special flood hazard areas.
• May not extend beyond building footprint.
• May not encroach into required yards, except where main dwelling is permitted to extend into rear yard.

FAR
Basements (even habitable ones) do not count as floor area if first floor is no more than 3' above grade.

Fig 35 Basement & grade

Excavated features

There are two types of excavated features:
• Light wells and stairwells
• Below-grade patios

FAR
Excavation will not affect grade or measurement of floor area if standards are met (see pages 42 and 43).

Fig 36 Excavated feature & grade

A: distance between top of first floor and grade if excavation meets the size/dimensional limits described in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43.

B: distance between top of first floor and grade if excavated features exceed the size/dimensional limits described in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43.

Top of first floor

Grade if excavated features meet standards described in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43.

Grade if excavated features exceed standards described in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43.

visual_elements.description: A cross-sectional diagram showing a building with basement and excavated feature areas. It illustrates two vertical measurements labeled A and B from the top of the first floor down to the grade line. The basement and excavated feature areas are shaded differently. Labels indicate 'Basement' and 'Excavated feature'. The diagram explains that measurement A applies if excavation meets size/dimensional limits, and measurement B applies if excavated features exceed those limits. Additional notes clarify how grade is determined based on whether excavated features meet or exceed standards.
A patterned graphic representing basement and grade area, composed of a repeated hatch pattern forming a stepped shape.

Two shaded grey text boxes containing FAR (Floor Area Ratio) rules: one for basements stating they do not count as floor area if first floor is no more than 3' above grade; the other for excavated features stating excavation will not affect grade or floor area measurement if standards are met (with reference to pages 42 and 43).
visual_elements.location: Middle of the page, one under Basement standards and one under Excavated features

visual_elements.description: A vertical dark grey sidebar on the left side of the page containing the section title 'Basements & Excavated features', a descriptive paragraph about floor area regulations, and a list of code sections with page references.

additional_notes: Page number 40 is indicated at bottom left corner.
References to figures 35 and 36 are present under respective sections.
References to figures 39-40 on pages 42-43 are noted for dimensional limits and standards.
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
